page.title: 02Our School In Fulwood.
page.content: Ours is a Church Of England School, opened in 1976 by the Bishop Martineau of Blackburn. It was built for a new estate and was named St. Peter's after a church that was being closed down. The school has 7 classes. The numbers in the classes vary from 27-34. The majority of the school is open plan.In the heart of the school is a big hall and as you step on the polished floor you are faced with a wooden screen. On assembly days and Sundays the screen pulls back leaving an altar, lectern and sanctuary. Behind you there are climbing frames and ropes. There are several uses for this hall:- dining, P.E., singing and assemblies. In the field around our school we have running tracks, rounders, football and cricket pitches. We have two playgrounds for infants and juniors.
